name: UpdateGithubRelease
description:
Edit a GitHub release with push access.

Use this tool when you need to modify an existing release on a GitHub repository for which you have push access. It allows updating release information such as the title, description, and other metadata.

parameters.name: repository_owner
parameters.description: The account owner of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

value_schema.description: The account owner of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

parameters.name: repository_name
parameters.description: The name of the repository. This field is not case sensitive.

value_schema.description: The name of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

parameters.name: release_identifier
parameters.description: The unique integer identifier for the GitHub release to be updated.

value_schema.description: The unique identifier of the release.

parameters.name: release_description
parameters.description: Text describing the contents and details of the release tag.

value_schema.description: Text describing the contents of the tag.

parameters.name: set_as_latest_release
parameters.description: Specifies if this release should be the latest. Use 'true', 'false', or 'legacy'. Drafts/prereleases aren't eligible.

value_schema.description: Specifies whether this release should be set as the latest release for the repository. Drafts and prereleases cannot be set as latest. Defaults to `true` for newly published releases. `legacy` specifies that the latest release should be determined based on the release creation date and higher semantic version.

parameters.name: release_name
parameters.description: The name of the release to be updated in the repository. This is a user-friendly name for the release.

value_schema.description: The name of the release.

parameters.name: release_tag_name
parameters.description: The name of the tag for the GitHub release. Used to identify the release version.

value_schema.description: The name of the tag.

parameters.name: commitish_value
parameters.description: Determines the source for the Git tag; can be a branch or commit SHA. Defaults to the repo's default branch if the tag exists.

value_schema.description: Specifies the commitish value that determines where the Git tag is created from. Can be any branch or commit SHA. Unused if the Git tag already exists. Default: the repository's default branch (usually `master`).

parameters.name: is_draft
parameters.description: Set to `true` to make the release a draft, `false` to publish it.

value_schema.description: `true` makes the release a draft, and `false` publishes the release.

parameters.name: mark_as_prerelease
parameters.description: Set `true` to mark the release as a prerelease, or `false` to identify as a full release.

value_schema.description: `true` to identify the release as a prerelease, `false` to identify the release as a full release.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the GitHub API.

parameters.name: owner
parameters.description: The account owner of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

value_schema.description: The account owner of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

parameters.name: repo
parameters.description: The name of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

value_schema.description: The name of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

parameters.name: release_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the release.

value_schema.description: The unique identifier of the release.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Text describing the contents of the tag.

value_schema.description: Text describing the contents of the tag.

parameters.name: draft
parameters.description: `true` makes the release a draft, and `false` publishes the release.

value_schema.description: `true` makes the release a draft, and `false` publishes the release.

parameters.name: make_latest
parameters.description: Specifies whether this release should be set as the latest release for the repository. Drafts and prereleases cannot be set as latest. Defaults to `true` for newly published releases. `legacy` specifies that the latest release should be determined based on the release creation date and higher semantic version.

value_schema.description: Specifies whether this release should be set as the latest release for the repository. Drafts and prereleases cannot be set as latest. Defaults to `true` for newly published releases. `legacy` specifies that the latest release should be determined based on the release creation date and higher semantic version.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the release.

value_schema.description: The name of the release.

parameters.name: prerelease
parameters.description: `true` to identify the release as a prerelease, `false` to identify the release as a full release.

value_schema.description: `true` to identify the release as a prerelease, `false` to identify the release as a full release.

parameters.name: tag_name
parameters.description: The name of the tag.

value_schema.description: The name of the tag.

parameters.name: target_commitish
parameters.description: Specifies the commitish value that determines where the Git tag is created from. Can be any branch or commit SHA. Unused if the Git tag already exists. Default: the repository's default branch (usually `master`).

value_schema.description: Specifies the commitish value that determines where the Git tag is created from. Can be any branch or commit SHA. Unused if the Git tag already exists. Default: the repository's default branch (usually `master`).

secrets.description: The OAuth token to use for authentication.
